bibl.title: Transfigurations of Hellenism. Aspects of Late Antique Art in Egypt AD 250-700. (Probleme der Ägyptologie. 23.)
bibl.note: et 180 figg. n./bl. sur 77 pll. + 21 pll. coul.

I. Introduction: A visit to the Coptic Museum in Old Cairo. - II. Images of late antique Egypt in twentieth-century art history. - III. On methods. - IV. History, society, and art in late Roman and early Byzantine Egypt. - V. Continuity and change 1: The survival of forms of Alexandrian Hellenistic architecture. - VI. Continuity and change 2: New patterns of monumentality. - VII. Images for mortuary display. - VIII. Images of the good life: display and style. - IX. The Christianization of art in late antique Egypt. - Epilogue: Perennial hellenism? - Abbreviations. Index.
TÖRÖK László, Transfigurations of Hellenism. Aspects of Late Antique Art in Egypt AD 250-700. (Probleme der Ägyptologie. 23.)
Leiden, E.J. Brill, 2005, 8°, xxvii-400 pp. et 180 figg. n./bl. sur 77 pll. + 21 pll. coul. ISBN 90-04-14332-7. €191.
